## Purpose
Simple timing utility for debugging performance measurements in Rich library components. Provides a context manager that measures and prints execution time.

## Key Components

### timer() function (L12-19)
- **Type**: Context manager decorator
- **Parameters**: `subject` (str, default "time") - label for timing output
- **Behavior**: Captures start time on entry, calculates elapsed time on exit, prints formatted result in milliseconds
- **Usage Pattern**: Wrap code blocks to measure execution duration
- **Output Format**: "{subject} elapsed {elapsed_ms:.1f}ms"

## Dependencies
- `time.time()` (L6) - High-resolution timing source
- `contextlib` (L8) - Context manager decorator support
- `typing.Generator` (L9) - Type annotation for context manager protocol

## Implementation Details
- Uses `time()` function for millisecond-precision timing (L15, L17)
- Converts seconds to milliseconds with 1 decimal place precision (L18-19)
- Prints directly to stdout - no return value or logging integration
- Designed specifically for debugging/development use (not production timing)

## Architectural Notes
- Single-purpose utility module following Unix philosophy
- No state management or persistence - ephemeral timing only
- Direct print output makes it unsuitable for structured logging environments
